name: Citadines Central Xi'an

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a difficult time checking in. They don't speak English well. But they requested my charge card and promptly charged 2 night room fee + extra $$. They made me sign the charge slip. I said that not the correct amount. They said they will give me a credit when I check out. Checking out , They handed me a invoivce for 2 night room fee. I insisted on getting a charge credit slip on the amount 2 night room fee + extra $$. Continuing to insist for the credit, they finally relented and reverse the original charge. I then charge the check out bill. As far as the room, The curtains/drape were filthy, the window were caked with dirt that one can barley see out.
reviews.title: Don't stay at this hotel. Rooms are dirty, and the location on dark streets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Citadines is located within the old city walls close to the Mosque & the surrounding markets. The hotel is a bit tired but was clean, however the bed was extremely hard. Breakfast was poor.
reviews.title: Well located Hotel
Don't stay too long
reviews.text: I am staying as a long staying guest in this hotel for 2 months. Everything was fine on the time of arrival. Then after 2 days the trouble started. Day 3 : no more drinking water Day 4 : no more bathroom ammenities Day 15 : no more tissues.......and so on. Everytime same reply, because you stay soo long ,we don't give this service anymore. Rooms are nice and ok but service is of the lowest level. My advise,you can stay here but not too long because after some time they don't care about the guests anymore. Even though my company is having 3 long staying guests in this hotel,they still don't care. Think twice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Citadines for 2 nights in Xi'an. Chose this apt/hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. We had a great experience at Oakwood (another Apt/hotel we found on Tripadvisor), so we gave Citadines a try. For the price we paid, the room is clean and spacious. However, their water system must be dated, because there is no warm water for more than a minute. It goes from hot to cold to warm to hot. The second night we were there, there was only cold water. When I called to complain, they said their pipes were broken, so no hot/warm water for the evening. Not good! Will not stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice rooms and I liked it until I had to take a shower! Only Hot or Cold water.

reviews.text: We stayed at Citadines in September in order to visit the Terracotta Warriors. Our 3 night visit was very comfortable with everything and more than we needed. The quiet location was very welcome as I was unwell during our stay- NOT the hotel's fault I hasten to say.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel

reviews.text: Although quiet all the local attractions where very close by. The staff were courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Unbelievable value for money

reviews.text: LOCATION - The 3-star Citadines Apart Hotel is located near the center of the Old City, a block or two from the Muslim Quarter and it's lively market. The Bell Tower is only a couple blocks away, and it's about three blocks to the Great Mosque. The area immediately around the hotel is pretty seedy, and there is nothing around but sign-making shops. There are no bars or upscale restaurants in the area, though there is a fast food place next door (Taste of Singapore) for cheap eats that is also the breakfast place for the hotel. The area around the hotel is very dark at night. The hotel is surrounded by run-down apartment buildings and construction sites - you can see them all from the roof top terrace. We saw other reviews mentioning sitting and drinking a beer up here, but during our stay we didn't see any chairs up there, it was just a place to walk and look at the pretty grisly looking buildings around the hotel. In the distance, you could see the city skyline. At street level, the shops are on the bottom level, with apartments above, so you don't really notice the run-down apartment buildings as you walk through the old town.
reviews.title: #1 on TripAdvisor? Are the Other Hotels in Xi'An that Bad?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN - Upon check-in, the front desk staff was borderline rude, especially compared to the great service we'd received in Beijing on our previous stop. They processed us and gave us our breakfast coupons and room key without so much as a word, barely even looking up from their papers. No explanation of the facilities, no asking if we had any preferences, no map or brochure of the area or the hotel, nothing - just here's your room key, get out of my face. After we read our breakfast coupons, we realized there was an error.
reviews.title: Trendy Aparthotel

reviews.text: We paid 598Y on a special "Citibank" rate through the hotel's website for a 1-Bedroom Deluxe room. With this rate, it includes breakfast for 1 person if booking a studio, 2 people if a 1-bedroom, or for 4 people if booking a 4-bedroom. This rate is only available if paying with a Citibank credit card. When we arrived, the hotel staff gave us coupons for 1 person for breakfast. When we told them that our rate was for 2 people for breakfast, they first argued with us, told us we were wrong, then mocked us. I told them I could show them on their webpage what it said, and they first refused, then mocked us some more, then finally let me show them. Of course, it said exactly what I typed above. When shown that it said that, first they told me the webpage was wrong (this is their official website), then when I asked for a manager, they called him. He came down after about 10 minutes, walked straight to the computer without a word or looking at us, said a couple things to the employees, and continued to stand there without looking up until one of the other staff members told me "ok, we'll make an exception this time", like they were doing me a favor by providing the breakfast they advertised. All told, over 30 minutes wasted on whether we got a breakfast or not, and the manager couldn't even say a word to me (although he did speak English) or even look at me. We had to find the bellman to get assistance with our bags.
reviews.title: Very good for what you pay for...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE ROOM - When we finally arrived in our room, we found the carpets stained and the walls dirty. The room smelled like wet paint, though it had not been painted - I think it was from the sign making shops across the street, though they were also doing some work upstairs. The sliding bathroom door was stuck, and you had to really lay into it to get it to close. The room was decent sized, very basic with Ikea-style furniture, but with the basic necessities like free broadband internet in the room, A/C, flat screen tv, stereo, and kitchenette. The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. There are large windows wrapping around the apartment, but the room we had just looked across the street at a run-down apartment building, so we didn't have them open much - ask for a high floor to get a good view. We asked for one, but naturally were told that there wasn't any available, though we saw about three people during our entire four-day stay. Later that day, our room started to smell like two-day old fish. I think it was from the restaurant next door, but maybe it was the paint I'm not sure. When I called the front desk staff about it, they came up and informed me that it was my fault because I didn't turn on the vent fan over the stove to circulate the smell out. I tried to explain that I had no food in the apartment, and that the smell was coming in through the vents from somewhere else, but he only smirked like I was lying. The engineer was sent up, and he proceeded to show me how to turn on the vent fan. I tried to tell him too, but he didn't speak English and didn't understand. I told them it still smelled, and they said to just run the fan longer. So, the solution to our room stinking fish and paint was that I should run the vent fan the entire time of our stay, rather than offering us another room or even offering an explanation of what the smell was. Amazing.
reviews.title: Who could want for more?

reviews.text: THE HOTEL - During our stay, the elevator broke, and a leak in the skylight poured water into the sixth-floor atrium. When we asked the front desk for a taxi, they seemed confused, and ran around talking on the walkie talkies. First they fell all over themselves to find out exactly how we booked our show, which was so they could write a note for me to give the dinner show (telling them of course that we had booked through the hotel so they could get a commission, although we didn't - they were just trying to scam them). When we got to the show, we asked them what it said, and they confirmed our suspicions, but I had already paid for the show anyway, so they got nothing. We thought they were calling a cab, but turns out they were instead getting a trainee to run out to the main street in the pouring rain and hail a cab for us. The poor guy stood out there in the downpour getting drenched for about 15 minutes while we wondered what was going on and if he was coming back or if we were going to make our dinner show on time. Finally he got a taxi for us, but he was soaked to the bone - I have no idea why he didn't call a taxi like a normal hotel, or why he didn't take one of the umbrellas with him that were sitting right next to us in the lobby for free use. Very odd. He braved the rain for a few more minutes to reaffirm that we would give the dinner show their scam note, then we finally left.
reviews.title: Great location, very accommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very stylish modern decor, well equipped kitchen, spacious, helpful staff and well located in the city centre in a quiet street. Plus free broadband. What more can I say?
reviews.title: Excellent + free broadband

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel and only wished we could have stayed here longer. The room was large, bright, nice furniture, great shower. The front desk arranged for our early taxi to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Spacious, Clean, Convenient, Modern

reviews.text: We - a couple with a young adolescent daughter - spent two nights at the Citadines Xi'an in mid-late July. The other reviews are correct - this is a great option especially for families with kids (hotel rooms can prove costly and disagreably crowded for them). Citadines studio apartments are spacious and comfortable, and 1 BR apts are also available. For those familiar with the IBIS chain, t Citadines studio is maybe 2-3 times the size of IBIS rooms (while less expensive), with a similar clean and modern design along the IKEA lines. Rooms come with a kitchen. We booked our room through Wotif - about 2 USD per day more expensive than the summer sale price had we booked directly with the hotel, with the added advantage of being able to cancel our reservation. Everything worked perfectly - the hotel had our reservation on file. The hotel is very well located and all worked well. The airport shuttle bus stop is about 1-2 minutes walk away, on the main square just to the right of the road leading to the Citadines. They also have self service laundry facilities on the 4th floor as I recall - around 40 yuan I think for a full load including the dryer - buy your token at the front desk. Following Sobesparky's advice we went to the roof in the evening - nice partial view of the main square and surrounding buildings all lit up. We would not hesitate returning, or going to another Citadines in another city in the future.
reviews.title: Fantastic value, clean, spacious and real well located

reviews.text: The location was fantastic, the rooms were spacious. We booked through wotif.com and they offered a tour package which as we found out didn't exist however the reception did all they could to make this up to us so we didn't mind. We ended up booking a driver through the hotel. Larry's restaurant at the base of the building is good too! If you want to go dancing check out Salsa near Pearson's just near the Drum Tower. finally the roof terrace is ideal to drink a beer at the end of the day (you need to byo) and watch the lights come on!
reviews.title: everyone is right - this is the best!

reviews.text: My wife, my two preteen daughters and I were there for 2 nights. It was a very pleasant experience. With preteens, we honestly feel this hotel was as good as some of the luxury hotels we tend to stay at such as Marriott, Loews, Sheraton and even Westin, if not better. The room was clean, quiet and had good air conditioning, which was very nice given the outside temperatures were at 100+ degrees while we were there.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with preteen children

description: Citadines Central Xi’an is the first international brand serviced residence in Xi’an. Its ideal location in the city centre places it within walking distance to office towers with multinational companies, famous local specialty food street and cafés, and a bustling street bazaar. Just an hour's drive from the city center is the famous Terra cotta Warriors, a Unesco World Heritage Site. At Citadines, you can have the freedom to live the life you want. Just choose from our menu of flexible services to suit your lifestyle and budget.Your serviced residence has everything you need for rest, work and play - in a living space that doubles up as a home office with wireless internet access. The residence features a fully-equipped kitchen and living room, separate from the bedroom, so you can invite friends over or recharge after a hard day's work.The sleek home entertainment system with cable TV mounded on wall and slides smoothly from bedroom to living room, so you can watch TV or enjoy your favorite music wherever you want.Drop by the Breakfast Lounge for freshly brewed coffee. Or work out at the Fitness Corner and relax at the TV Lounge - the options are endless. At Citadines, you will find friendly staff who are delighted to share their local knowledge and help you settle in quickly and experience the local culture.Citadines Central Xi’an is one of a vibrant collection of The Ascott Limited’s serviced residences in over 70 cities in Asia Pacific, Europe and the Gulf Region. A member of CapitaLand, it is the global leader in branded serviced residences, bringing you more than 25 years’ experience in supporting travellers who work and live away from home.
